author: anon.
contents:
Glossary with selected words from Iliad 2, 201-18.
Similarities with the D-scholia, the Lexicon Homericum of Apollonius Sophista, Hesychius, Suda and the paraphrase attributed to Psellus.
statepreservation: single papyrus fragment (9.5 x 15 cm) broken off on the left and right side and at the foot, containing 2 columns with remains of respectively 22 and 18 lines (only some initial letters remain) of writing; verso is written upside down in relation to the text on the recto side; surviving upper margin of 2 cm
lectionalsigns:
-no lectional signs;
-once addition of a missing letter supra lineam (col. 1, l. 21);
-each new entry starts on a new line; second and any further lines of an entry are distinguished from the first line by eisthesis; blank spaces separate lemmata from explanation
hand: medium-sized; coarse; cursive elements (col. 1, l. 8 ? as open-topped square); crossbar of ? is extended and joins the following letter; ending horizontal of the ? sometimes extended at the end; generally bilinear; decoration: roundels and serifs on some letters
